data.title: About – USSSA Space Coast Complex
data.text:
USSSA Space Coast Stadium has served as the spring training facility for the Florida Marlins (1994–2002), Montreal Expos (2003–2004), and Washington Nationals (2005–2016) and as the home field of the Brevard County Manatees (1994–2016). After a $50 million renovation the state of the art complex has reopened as a baseball/softball venue complete with 15 Astro turf fields and is now the home of the USSSA Pride. As of November 2017, the brand new USSSA Space Coast Complex is open for events. The complex, owned and operated by the largest multi-sport company in the world, United States Specialty Sports Association (USSSA) underwent nearly a year of construction and now is ready to host teams for 2018.With 50 years of experience in sporting event planning, organizing and executing, USSSA sets and upholds the standard for what it means to run a successful event. We can guarantee a pleasant experience at USSSA Space Coast Complex. Our complex offers everything your team might need located at one pristine facility. Aside from our 15 turf fields, 5 of which are NCAA approved, we are equipped with on-site covered batting cages, weight room availability, live streaming, Flightscope tracking radar, fully operating score boards on every field, three HD video boards, stadium field suites, Musco LED lighting, 4K capable control room and dining packages.Our 1.3 million square feet of AstroTurf easily handles 8 inches of rain and requires zero field maintenance after a rain delay to prep the field, maximizing your playing experience. Brevard County attracts tourists from all over the world. Our 72 miles of coastline and beaches, the Kennedy Space Center, proximity to major theme parks and beautiful weather all help to create a perfect outdoor sports oasis on the east coast of central Florida.

Space Coast Complex has a whole new face. After a year of construction, we are excited to open our doors and highlight why the USSSA Space Coast Complex is the premium place to play and host sporting events:

Brand new $50 million state-of-the-art multi-purpose complex

15 AstroTurf fields

Advanced broadcast capabilities

Live stream capabilities on every field

Musco LED Lighting on all fields

Amenities include covered batting cages, 3 full-sized HD video boards, 15 fully operational scoreboards

Accessibility of Space Coast Complex

15 minute drive from the coast and beaches

15 minute drive from Melbourne International Airport

45 minute drive from Orlando International Airport

60 minute drive from Daytona Beach International Airport

60 minute drive from Universal Studios & Orlando theme parks

Why Viera?:

USSSA moved its National Headquarters to Viera in Brevard County, Florida in January

Brevard County is full of multiple beautiful beaches, family friendly activities, shopping and dining.

Home of Florida’s Space Coast with over 72 miles of coastline

Beachfront properties

Westgate Cocoa Beach Pier

Canaveral National Seashore – 23 miles of undeveloped beaches

Port Canaveral – the world’s 3rd largest cruise passenger port

Team-building Activities

Treetop Trek Aerial Adventures at Brevard Zoo

Warrior Course at Sky Zone Space Coast

Frisbee Golf at Duran Golf Course

National home of space exploration

Kennedy Space Center Visitor Complex

American Space Museum and Space Walk Hall of Fame

Discounted tickets

Brevard Zoo

Universal Studios

Kennedy Space Center

Sky Zone Space Coast

Wildlife

Merritt Island National Wildlife Refuge

Thousand Islands in Cocoa Beach

Shopping & Dining

The Avenues – outdoor shopping with over 70 stores, 20 restaurants, and AMC theatre

The Cove – Port Canaveral’s port entertainment district

Beachfront Dining

Visit one of Brevard County’s unique cities:
